4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (02:04): if you want to be able to suspend to ram enable it in the yast -> system -> power management module

5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:06): does anybody has problems with ssh?
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:06): it hungs waiting for command execution
3d09ca4c5cda5163a739c94ec390b292 (02:06): im gonna guess you didnt open the firewall
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:07): the problem is when ttys get involved with sshd
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:07): i cannot fingure out what goes so wrong with ttys
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:09): so if you "ssh host", you log in, get a tty, and get to a prompt, right?
2d241e739d0d51b22de7eb6e4637046c (02:10): i also got a question about ssh
2d241e739d0d51b22de7eb6e4637046c (02:11): he asks for password but not login
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:15): sputnik: yes, it does give me a tty
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:15): but it;s not what i want
2d241e739d0d51b22de7eb6e4637046c (02:15): but is there a possibility to use it like the bitvise tunnelier client for windows with an sftp window?
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:16): georgemv odd, though... i tried "ssh -T host echo foo" and it worked
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:17): what's the program that you are trying to run?  actually an echo?
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:17): i can't fingure out what goes wrong with the ttys...
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:17): but the two options are different
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:17): T disables tty allocation.  t forces it
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:18): if it is interactive (top or pine, for instance), you'll have to allocate a tty
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:18): which is not done by default
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:19): so if you want to run something like that, you'll need to specify -t every time
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:24): the problem is not the 'echo foo'
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:24): the problem is sftp and scp
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:25): when ssh tryes to call the sftp subsystem, the same hung occurs
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:25): and i can't figure it out
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:26): is sftp subsystem enabled on remote host?
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:26): are you using ssh v2?
5dc12f072c0bf03c1cb9cb46b9618d5e (02:28): when is sends the scp command, it hungs
c6654538388d52d795f45f1a55a844f5 (02:28): pm me the whole output
